executiveSummary: Nick Taranto and Josh Hicks, founders of Plated, pitched their meal kit delivery service to the Sharks, requesting $500,000 for 4% equity at a $12.5 million valuation. After presenting their business model of delivering pre-portioned ingredients with recipe cards, they received one offer from Mark Cuban for $500,000 at a $9 million valuation (approximately 5.5%) plus advisory shares, which they took time to consider.
keyDecisions: Mark Cuban made an offer of $500,000 at $9 million valuation with additional advisory shares matching their best advisor deal. The founders requested time to discuss the offer before making a final decision.

actionItems.task: Send free trial to Mark Cuban to get feedback on the product
Launch San Francisco warehouse and operations
Discuss and evaluate Mark Cuban's offer terms
Launch new product lines beyond meal kits

nextSteps: Nick and Josh will discuss Mark Cuban's offer privately to determine if they will accept the $500,000 investment at a $9 million valuation with advisory shares, which differs from their initial ask of 4% equity at $12.5 million valuation.
